Pre-Game Insights: India captain Rohit Sharma insists the “emotions” and “pressure” as hosts of the Cricket World Cup will not get to his side in Sunday’s final.
India have long been the heavy favourites for the tournament and, with a perfect 10 so far in this edition, nothing has changed in advance of their showdown with Australia in Ahmedabad.
Rohit said before the final, “Emotionally it’s a big, big thing”.
Captain Pat Cummins, says his team must “embrace” the challenge of facing their opponents, the enormous crowd in Ahmedabad Stadium and the will of 1.5 billion people.
Cummins said, “You’ve got to be up for it, you got to love it and just know whatever happens it’s fine but you just want to finish the day with no regrets.”
Australian legend Jason Gillespie told Al Jazeera in his preview of the final that while India are a great side, they are still “ripe for the taking”.
Cummins said, “They’ve been playing really well – undefeated this tournament. But we know at our best we can give them a good shake.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The 130,000-capacity Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad is the biggest cricket ground in the world.

India have won all 10 games to this stage, including their opening match against Australia in which they recovered from the loss of three early wickets with only two runs on the board to chase down 200.
Head to head India have won 57 of the ODI meetings between these sides while Australia have claimed 83 victories.
The most famous being the 2003 final in Johannesburg, which the Aussies won by 125 runs.
The last 10 meetings are split equally but the hosts do have the group-stage victory at this year’s tournament.
